                  </form> [and <foreign lang="ar">بِالقَبَلِ</foreign>] <hi rend="ital">He poured the water into the trough while his camels were drinking, so that it came upon them:</hi> (T, TA:) or <foreign lang="ar">قَبَلٌ</foreign> signifies a man's <hi rend="ital">bringing his camels to water, and drawing the water over their mouths, not having prepared for them aught</hi> [<hi rend="ital">thereof</hi>] <hi rend="ital">before that:</hi> (As, TA:) and <foreign lang="ar">سَقَى عَلَى إِبِلِهِ قَبَلًا</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">he poured the water over the mouths of his camels:</hi> (M, TA:) and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n42516-1" target="أَقَبْلَ" n="1" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar"/>عَلَى إِبِلِهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">he drew the water over the heads of his camels while they drank,</hi> 
                  <pb n="2984"/> 
                  <hi rend="ital">when they had drunk what was in the trough,</hi> (Lh, M, TA,) <hi rend="ital">not having prepared it before that:</hi> and this is the most severe mode of watering.                   <foreign lang="ar">دَوْلَةٌ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">Good fortune;</hi> &amp;c.; see <foreign lang="ar">تامِكُ</foreign>]: and <foreign lang="ar">عِزَّةٌ</foreign> [<hi rend="ital">might;</hi> &amp;c.]. (Kull, p. 64.)          <sense type="b" n="10">-b10-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَقْبَلَ عَلَيْهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He showed favour to him:</hi> or, more properly, <hi rend="ital">he presented a favourable aspect to him;</hi> or, accord. to general usage, <hi rend="ital">he met him kindly;</hi> see <foreign lang="ar">بَشَّ لَهُ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="11">-b11-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَقْبَلَتْ عَلَيْهِ الدُّنْيَا</foreign>, (A, art. <foreign lang="ar">فتح</foreign>,) <hi rend="ital">The world favoured him.</hi>          <sense type="b" n="12">-b12-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَقْبَلَ عَلَى شَىْءٍ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He set about,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commenced, doing a thing.</hi> (K, &amp;c.)          <sense type="b" n="13">-b13-</sense>  See <foreign lang="ar">تَصَدَّدَ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="14">-b14-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">أَقْبَلَ عَلَيْهِ</foreign> 
                  <hi rend="ital">He clave to it:</hi> and <hi rend="ital">he took to, set about, began,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">commenced it;</hi> as also <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n42511-2" target="قَبَلَ" n="2" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar" select="n42509"/>عليه</foreign>. (K.)          <sense type="b" n="15">-b15-</sense>  [<foreign lang="ar">أَقْبَلَ عَلَيْهِ بِالسَّيْفِ</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">بِالعَصَا</foreign>, and <foreign lang="ar">بِالسَّوْطِ</foreign>

                  </form>: see <foreign lang="ar">اِسْتَدْبَرَهُ</foreign>. <hi rend="ital">He faced him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it.</hi> (TA) <hi rend="ital">He turned his face towards him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">it.</hi>          <sense type="b" n="2">-b2-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">He came before his face.</hi>          <sense type="b" n="3">-b3-</sense>  <hi rend="ital">He went to meet him; he met him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">encountered him. He saw it before him: he looked forward to it: he saw it,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knew it, beforehand. He saw,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">knew, at the beginning of it what he did not see,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">know, at the end thereof.</hi>          <sense type="b" n="4">-b4-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">استقبلهُ بِأَمْرٍ</foreign> (T, S, K, &amp;c., in art. <foreign lang="ar">بده</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">He met him,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">encountered him, with a thing.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an affair,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">an action.</hi> (TK in art. <foreign lang="ar">بده</foreign>.)          <sense type="b" n="5">-b5-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">استقبلهُ بِمَا يَكْرَهُ</foreign> (A, K, in art. <foreign lang="ar">بكت</foreign>, &amp;c.) <hi rend="ital">He encountered him with,</hi> or, as it often means, <hi rend="ital">he accused him, to his face, of a thing that he disliked,</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hated:</hi> see <foreign lang="ar">بَكَّتَهُ</foreign>; and the phrases <foreign lang="ar">اَلبْهتُ ٱسْتِقْبَالُكَ أَخَاكَ بِمَا لَيْسَ فِيهِ</foreign> and <foreign lang="ar"> <ref cref="n42514-1" target="قَابَلَهُ" n="1" type="5" subtype="FSO" lang="ar" select="n42510"/>بِالكَذبِ</foreign>, voce <foreign lang="ar">بَهَتَهُ</foreign>; and <foreign lang="ar">استقبلهُ بِالحَقِّ</foreign>, voce <foreign lang="ar">قَرَحَهُ</foreign>; in both senses like <foreign lang="ar">لَقِيَهُ بِمَكْرُوهٍ</foreign>.          <sense type="b" n="6">-b6-</sense>  <foreign lang="ar">اِسْتَقْبَلْتُهُ بِكَلَامٍ فِيهِ</foreign>
